svg.text: First Implementation - Foundation Setting Phase (8-12 weeks)
IMPLEMENTATION SCOPE: FIRST CUSTOMER - GREENFIELD DEPLOYMENT
Mid-size public company, 1,200 employees, $500M revenue, manufacturing industry
Excel-based SOX process, ServiceNow GRC license expiring, CFO seeking cost reduction
Week 2-4: Understanding Current State & Future Vision
Week 5-7: Identifying & Planning for Implementation Risks
• SAP integration: Dedicated RFC specialist, pilot testing in dev environment
• Excel compatibility: Cross-version testing matrix, fallback to web interface
• User adoption: Champion network, gradual rollout, extensive training program
• Auditor acceptance: Early engagement, detailed documentation, parallel run period
Week 6-8: Detailed Project Planning & Resource Allocation
• First SOX Cycle: 12-16 weeks (testing and refinement)
✓ Technical architecture approved by IT and Security
🔍 Discovery Phase: Everything must be learned from scratch - business processes, technical constraints, user preferences
⚠️ High Stakes: First implementation sets precedent for all future deployments - failure risk is maximum
💡 Foundation Investment: All templates, patterns, and learnings from this implementation enable 10x faster subsequent deployments
success. This phase determines entire project fate.
